subject: Re: [junit] junit xml schema?
msgSnippet: Jason, The XML format that has become standard was the one created by the ant team.  A search for ant junit xml reveals some potentially useful links,
messageBody:
Jason,

The XML format that has become standard was the one created by the ant
team. A search for "ant junit xml" reveals some potentially useful
links, including this one:

http://old.nabble.com/schema-for-junit-xml-output-td22193385.html

Hope this helps,

David Saff

On Thu, Dec 10, 2009 at 7:34 PM, lcghent <jlundy@...> wrote:
> Hey folks!
>
> This is sorta related to junit, but not specifically.  I am writing some scripts to do some automated tests and need to report it to our Hudson servers in a junit style xml format.  Unfortunately after I want to say is hundreds of web searches I have been unable to find a good explanation of what the junit xml format is.
>
> Does anyone have a good page or know of a link to a schema or dtd or something for it.
>
> Thanks
> Jason
>
